audio_caption: The clip begins with an electric guitar playing a bluesy tune with a groovy, relaxed feel. A male speaker starts, sounding apologetic for delays on a reveal video. He says, "Ruby Rose 2 Teresa, what is she going to be?". The music continues in the background under the speech.

The audio starts with a female speaker introducing that "She is going to be a Seawind 1370". Following the introduction, cheering sounds are heard. An energetic electronic music piece begins, featuring synth sounds and drum beats. The music fades as the female speaker explains that the "Seawind 1370" is a brand new catamaran and its design. She continues, saying that this new catamaran will be a 45 ft "performance cruiser", "blue water ready", and the "perfect live aboard catamaran". She then mentions that it will be a collaboration between "Ruby Rose" and "Seawind Catamarans". A male speaker agrees and starts to explain how Seawind catamarans has had 30 years of experience in building catamarans. He says the boat was designed by a "French naval architect" and then describes the boat as "stunning". The female speaker jokingly says he is also stunning. The male speaker jokingly responds, saying the female speaker should speak for herself. He says he is the "troller boat" that "drags himself" behind her. The female speaker disagrees with the male speaker's joke. The male speaker starts to explain how the collaboration came to be.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing a review series from Annapolis 2019 where they tested the market's best offerings, praising the "1260" and how it "ticked just about every single box." However, he adds the concern about space for living remotely for months away from civilization as they take a boat into the Pacific, indicating a thoughtful and analytical tone.

The clip starts with one male speaker recounting a conversation with Seawind, wherein Seawind mentioned a 45-foot boat in production for 2021 and invited them to provide input on its design. The speaker continues, stating that following a boat show, he took a secret trip to Vietnam to see the 1370 model and describes it as "stunning," a performance cruising catamaran with the desired storage space and performance, and a new innovative design. The speaker then shares how Seawind asked what they wanted in the boat. This narrative is punctuated by an underlying presence of distinct ticking noises.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing conversations between "Annapolis and Vietnam", mentioning "three full pages of design features" and "50 points". His tone is conversational and slightly enthusiastic. He then describes the importance of certain points and features, especially those crucial for "liverboards", stating "that needs to be put in". Following the speaker, we hear a brief "yeah" of agreement from what sounds like a female. He continues describing how the designers integrated all the considerations.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker confidently describing how they've "taken the best" from previous catamarans and integrated it into a new model, the "Seawind 1370". He mentions that production of the 1370 is planned for 2021 and that there will be different versions, starting with the "Ruby Rose 2" version. A female voice interjects a brief "Yeah." There is no music or background sounds discernible in the audio.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing a boat called the Ruby Rose 2, a version of the 1370, detailing its features and design innovations. His tone is informative and enthusiastic. This speech is interspersed with a backdrop of consistent, moderate rhythmic background music, featuring an electronic style with a positive mood. He concludes by stating that the listener will take a look at what the 1370 will be. This leads into a burst of more prominent music.

The audio clip begins with a single male speaker enthusiastically describing features of a helm, mentioning "ergonomic seat, armrests, footrests, cup holders, self-draining lockers and full 360 visibility." He continues discussing the trifold door that provides a "huge indoor-outdoor area" and a breakfast bar. The speaker then mentions a hard bimini, safety rails, and storage for paddleboards and fishing rods. There is an absence of music and background sounds.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker, calm and articulate, outlining requests made for a boat design, including "dedicated recesses for the cockpit clears," "hammer attachment points," and a "dedicated liferaft compartment." This is identified as a "big red line" needing to be "in the water within 30 seconds of needing it." Transitioning from speech, music begins, featuring an electronic style with a mellow tone. Subsequently, the same male speaker returns, suggesting, "Let's look to the saloon of the 1370."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing desired features for modular seating and open windows, emphasizing the importance of ventilation. He continues, outlining the specifications for a nav station, including 360 visibility, a dedicated nav seat, and the ability to control the boat from inside, all spoken in an informative tone. As the audio progresses, he details the galley features, such as Corian work services, an induction stove, a waste chute, and multiple fridge options. Transitioning to cabin features, he talks about the need for multiple opening hatches for ventilation, island beds, charging points, a vanity unit that doubles as a desk with multiple AC and DC charging points. He concludes with a brief description of the head, specifying electric toilets, a separate shower stall, and direct access to the engine. Throughout the speech segment, background music plays, characterized by an electronic or ambient style, creating a calm and relaxed mood.

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing practical design features of a product, mentioning soft edges and a separate recess for a life raft. He speaks in an informative tone. He notes the inclusion of secondary engine access and effective rain catchment. He praises the inclusion of a workshop, stating "amazing, well done Seawind." The speech is accompanied by upbeat electronic music. The music fades slightly, and the speaker moves on to discuss power generation, mentioning "Mastervolt."

The clip begins with a male speaker enthusiastically explaining how the boat includes two kilowatts of solar panels on the bimini hardtop, which he believes will be more than enough to power the boat. He continues in a confident tone, stating they opted for diesel engines for power and range, highlighting the addition of Mastervolt's 200-amp alternators, which can produce five kilowatts of power when the engines are running. This speaker further explains that a couple of hours of engine use will charge a full lithium battery bank, adding they also have the security of knowing they have a thousand miles of range using those diesel engines.

The clip begins with a male speaker, enthusiastically describing the boat's power storage and control system. He mentions "11,000 watt hours of mastervolt lithium batteries" and "a c-zone system", followed by highlighting control over onboard systems. His speech is accompanied by background music, reminiscent of electronic dance music with a driving beat and a dark, serious tone.

The audio starts with a male speaker, discussing statistics for a vessel, using an informative tone. He mentions its length, beam, and displacement, then moves on to performance data like mainsail and jib measurements, indicating a review or technical breakdown. He then shifts focus to polar diagrams, emphasizing the boat's speed in various wind conditions, maintaining an enthusiastic and impressed tone. Simultaneously, uplifting electronic music plays quietly in the background, creating a mood that complements the speaker's enthusiasm.

The audio clip begins with a female speaker describing a "Seawind 1370" catamaran as perfect for "liveaboard couples who want to sail off into the sunset." She expresses enthusiasm and excitement by saying, "And we are over the moon."

The clip starts with two excited voices, a woman and a man, announcing that they are getting a new home and boat. The man speaks enthusiastically about a collaboration with SeaWind and their knowledge from living on board, claiming they know what is needed to make a boat perfect. He continues to explain that they will film every aspect of the build, from start to launch, and their travels. A call to action follows, inviting viewers to subscribe and enable notifications. A brief, upbeat, positive background tune with acoustic guitar and drums follows, before the speakers say goodbye.
